title: Bleach (TV series)
data: Season 7 : The Arrancar Part 2 : The Hueco Mundo Sneak Entry ( 2007 )
Season 8 : The Arrancar Part 3 : The Fierce Fight ( 2007-2008 )
Season 9 : The New Captain Shūsuke Amagai ( 2008 )

Season 14 : The Arrancar Part 6 : Fall of the Arrancar ( 2010-2011 )
section_text: Main article : List of Bleach episodes Bleach is divided into sixteen seasons , five of which are original , self-contained story arcs of side stories not found in the original material .
intro: Bleach (Japanese: ブリーチ, Hepburn: Burīchi) is a Japanese anime television series based on Tite Kubo's manga of the same name. It was produced by Studio Pierrot and directed by Noriyuki Abe. The series aired on TV Tokyo from October 2004 to March 2012, spanning 366 episodes. The story follows the adventures of Ichigo Kurosaki after he obtains the powers of a Soul Reaper (死神, Shinigami, literally, Death God) - a death personification similar to the Grim Reaper - from another Soul Reaper, Rukia Kuchiki. His newfound powers force him to take on the duties of defending humans from evil spirits and guiding departed souls to the afterlife. The anime adaptation includes original storylines not found in the manga with repeated appearances and stories containing these original characters. Viz Media obtained foreign television and home video distribution rights to the Bleach anime on March 15, 2004. Cartoon Network's Adult Swim block began airing Bleach in the United States on September 9, 2006. The series' international release extends through dozens of countries in several languages, such as Spanish, French, German, Brazilian Portuguese and Tagalog.
